name: One Way To Die: Steam Edition
description: After waking from a terrifying dream of your own untimely death, you attempt to make your way to the Finnigan Brothers' Fun Park for its last day then back home again. It's like playing Russian roulette with five chambers loaded, but more frustrating.
minimum_requirements: OS: 7, 8, or 10 Processor: 1.2 Ghz Dual-Core Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: Intel, AMD, or Nvidia low profile Storage: 30 MB available space Sound Card: Any
recommended_requirements: OS: 7, 8, or 10 Processor: 1.8 Ghz Dual-Core Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: Intel, AMD, or Nvidia 1 GB dedicated Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 30 MB available space Sound Card: Any

reviews.review_text: I kept dying again and again, and i had fun.  Something is wrong with me.
Great game, Easy to get achievements. Took me an hr to get most of them. I like all teh death scenes especially the part where GabeN hunts you down and gets his fan boy army to kill you.
OOkey!!! for steam achievements

Now to start off I like to point out that this game does swear so if your not to see or hear swearing then do not get this game it is a good game from so many deaths it some funny ones like the unknown one or some others but yeah it has a great bit about that.Next the bad things it does not have bad storyline not a good storyline it has a medium one the storyline is you wake up from a dream where you die and you have a headache and then you remember its the last of a carnival and yeah you go out for the day and try not to die.so to end this comment on the game it is a medium game is would give 3 stars most likley.

For my own it's really have jokes word, n a little spooky... I like cuz there's have salty
got killed by GabeN i love this game would get killed by a surfboard again 10/10
Pretty funny game for couple minutes. And quick Achievements if anyone like that.

Most Interactive Fiction takes itself rather too seriously for my tastes, but this offering is delightfully different in its nihilistic fatalism: multiple times, by sheerest chance, I died before I could even get out of bed, and this sort of random threat keeps the replays that such a constant specter of death necessitates from becoming stale and same-y. I find this game more than worth the asking price of 'nothing,' and would go so far as to say I'd pay SEVERAL nothings for an experience of this caliber.

there is literaly no shortage in ways to die, ranging from getting a 404 error, all the way to being torn to pieces by zombies, but there is a way to finish, and i found it! game done, nuf sed. then i wake up and get folded in half  13/10 i died by diahreah
Dark Souls: A Text Based Game
Got killed by car bomb when i just eated sandwitch...  5/5 most realistic School Simulator on Steam.

Starts the game, 'You have died by the unknown! Start over!' (Didn't even get out the bed) Ok, no problem, restart. 'You have been crushed by a jet engine! Start over!' (Didn't even get out the bed) Ok, no problem, restart. 'You have been eaten by headcrabs! Start over!' (Didn't even get out the bed) Ok, no problem, restart. 'You have choked to death! Start over!' (Didn't even get out the bed) Ok, no problem, restart. 'You have died by bed! Start over!' (Didn't even get out the bed)  Basically it's a game where you're trying to get out the bed, but it won't let you. There's no ♥♥♥♥♥♥ way you can predict what will happen, except that u'll die for sure.  10/10 would die again.
'CSI and gamer's nightmare'

This game is fun when you first start, as you would most likely want to read the story to your friends. However, then you just die. No certain path, you just die. Soon you will get a little annoyed, but still read the story. Then you die. Again. And again. And again. And again. And again, and again, and again, and again, until you get so ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off that you click rapidly and hope to win the game. That is rare, but when you do, you feel good. Except for the fact that it just starts the story over again. Please do not play this game, I'm sorry everything that killed me, but I can't do this anymore than the 20 minutes I played it in total.

This game has nothing to offer other than a total waste of non-satisfactory time. Do NOT get involved with this or you will regret it. Especially if you're a 100% game gamer. The achieves have been added to TWICE now which means for those of us that perfected/100%-ed it the first time, we had to play the game one or two more times to keep it at 100%. Not Cool! This is a text game, similar to the old which-way adventure books. You are presented with a scenario with 1 to 3 choices. (Yeah, I know '1' choice isn't really a choice but you have no other option to choose from if you want to keep the game going) There's several different order of choices that can be chosen and will determine what achievements you may receive. This ends up being a long, drawn out game if you are in it for the achievements to get a 100% completion, with some achievements requiring a fairly deep correct set of choices to trigger.  Oh, did I mention you die almost every first or second choice? Yeah, not cool either. Stay away from at all costs, not worth the time & effort, you WILL be greatly disappointed by this game, probably more so than any family member has disappointed you :P Update Dec 2015: They've just added another new xmas achieve with 10 new deaths. So not only is this another achievement, it's a limited time one at that. >:(
What the ♥♥♥♥ is this ♥♥♥♥
You have died because of this game. Do not start over! Tried to be humorous, but this game is just plain stupid.

Things like this should stay at this guy's homepage. Considering it's 'written with Python'. So what's next? Bloggers selling their posts on Steam? Youtubers selling their let's plays? Why, those actually may require more effort than this guy has put into it.
This game is uhh... not fun. It tries to be funny, but... It's not, thats really all there is to say about it.

I had high hopes for this one because of the name, and it did cause a few chuckles, but the appeal rapidly waned. I died at least 20 times in the first 15 minutes, and there seems to be no control over how or whether or not the player gets killed. I gave it a good half hour before becoming termilly tired of the whole thing. All reading, no art, not my cup of tea.
button-mash = Win
Everything is random. No chances. Both fun and boring.
